title: How to Make White Peach Crumble

steps.headline: Bring a small saucepan of water to a simmer on the stove top.
steps.description: Set a bowl of cool water next to it. Cut a shallow X in the bottom of each peach and submerge in simmering water for about 30 seconds. Dunk in cold water, then peel off skin.

steps.headline: Repeat with all peaches.
steps.description: Slice peeled peaches into about 10-12 pieces each.

steps.headline: In a large bowl, combine all dry ingredients.
steps.description: Cut butter into 6 or 8 pieces and rub in to flour mixture to create coarse crumbs.

steps.headline: Place peach slices in a pie dish and distribute crumble topping over the top.
Bake at 375ºF for about 30 minutes, until the crumble browns at the edges and the peaches are tender.
steps.description: Let cool for at least 20-30 minutes before serving.

steps.headline: Serve with vanilla ice cream or plain.

text: Preheat the oven to 375ºF. (190C) Bring a small saucepan of water to a simmer on the stove top. Set a bowl of cool water next to it. Cut a shallow X in the bottom of each peach and submerge in simmering water for about 30 seconds. Dunk in cold water, then peel off skin. Repeat with all peaches. Slice peeled peaches into about 10-12 pieces each. In a large bowl, combine all dry ingredients. Cut butter into 6 or 8 pieces and rub in to flour mixture to create coarse crumbs. Place peach slices in a pie dish and distribute crumble topping over the top.  Bake at 375ºF for about 30 minutes, until the crumble browns at the edges and the peaches are tender. Let cool for at least 20-30 minutes before serving. Serve with vanilla ice cream or plain.
